snippet: Statements by a former Israeli national security adviser seemed to buttress a theory that Israeli saber rattling is primarily an effort to push the United States to bolster sanctions.
abstract: Former Israeli national security adviser Uzi Dayan says that the prime minister and the defense minister have not yet decided to attack Iran's nuclear facilities and could be dissuaded from a strike if President Obama approves stricter sanctions and confirms publicly its commitment to possibility of using military force; statement seems to support a theory that Israeli saber rattling is primarily an effort to push the United States to bolster sanctions.
lead_paragraph: Statements by a former Israeli national security adviser seemed to buttress a theory that Israeli saber rattling is primarily an effort to push the United States to bolster sanctions.

headline.seo: Israeli Leaders Said to Assert They Can Be Dissuaded From Iran Strike
headline.main: Israeli Leaders Could Be Dissuaded From Striking Iran
headline.print_headline: Israeli Leaders Are Said to Assert They Can Be Dissuaded From Striking Iran
